title: Introduction to Robotics Programming
description: Learn the fundamentals of robotics programming, from basic principles to advanced concepts. This comprehensive course covers everything you need to know to get started with robotics development.

modules.title: Foundations of Robotics
modules.description: Introduction to robotics systems, hardware components, and basic programming concepts.

lectures.title: Introduction to Robotics
lectures.description: Overview of robotics, its history, and modern applications.
lectures.content:
This lecture introduces you to the fascinating world of robotics. We'll explore the history of robotics from ancient automatons to modern industrial and consumer robots.

Topics covered:

  • History of robotics
  • Types of robots
  • Applications in industry and consumer products
  • Future of robotics

quiz.title: Introduction to Robotics Quiz
quiz.description: Test your understanding of basic robotics concepts.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a common type of robot?
When was the first industrial robot installed?
Robotics is an interdisciplinary branch of engineering and science.

lectures.title: Robot Hardware Components
lectures.description: Understanding the key hardware components that make up a robot.
lectures.content:
This lecture explores the essential hardware components that make up a robot. We'll examine sensors, actuators, controllers, and power systems.

Topics covered:

  • Sensors (vision, proximity, touch)
  • Actuators and motors
  • Controllers and processors
  • Power systems and batteries

quiz.title: Robot Hardware Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge of robot hardware components.

questions.question_text: Which sensor type is used for distance measurement?
Servos are a type of actuator.

lectures.title: Introduction to Robot Programming
lectures.description: Basic principles and languages used in robot programming.
lectures.content:
This lecture introduces the principles and languages used in robot programming. We'll look at popular programming languages and frameworks used in the field.

Topics covered:

  • Robot programming principles
  • Popular languages (Python, C++, ROS)
  • Programming paradigms
  • Simple control algorithms

quiz.title: Robot Programming Basics Quiz
quiz.description: Test your understanding of robot programming concepts.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a common language used in robotics?
ROS stands for Robot Operating System.

project.title: Build a Basic Robot Model
project.description: Create a detailed model of a robot, identifying and explaining all major components.
project.instructions:
For this project, you will create a detailed model of a robot (either physical or virtual) and identify all major components.

Requirements:

  1. Choose a robot type (industrial, mobile, humanoid, etc.)
  2. Identify and label all major hardware components
  3. Explain the function of each component
  4. Describe how the components interact
  5. Submit a report with diagrams and explanations

modules.title: Programming Fundamentals for Robotics
modules.description: Learn essential programming concepts and their application to robot control.

lectures.title: Variables and Data Types in Robotics
lectures.description: Understanding how variables and data types are used in robot programming.
lectures.content:
This lecture explores how variables and data types are used specifically in robotics programming. We'll look at representing sensor data, actuator commands, and robot state.

Topics covered:

  • Numeric data for sensor readings
  • Boolean logic for decision making
  • Arrays and lists for sensor arrays
  • Custom data types for robot state

quiz.title: Variables and Data Types Quiz
quiz.description: Test your understanding of variables and data types in robotics.

questions.question_text: Which data type is most appropriate for storing a robot's orientation?
A boolean variable can only have two possible values.

lectures.title: Control Structures for Robot Behavior
lectures.description: Using loops, conditionals, and other control structures for robot programming.
lectures.content:
This lecture focuses on how control structures like conditionals and loops are used to create robot behaviors. We'll explore decision-making algorithms and behavior control.

Topics covered:

  • If-else statements for sensor responses
  • Loops for continuous monitoring
  • Switch statements for state machines
  • Basic behavioral programming

quiz.title: Control Structures Quiz
quiz.description: Test your understanding of control structures in robotics.

questions.question_text: Which control structure is most appropriate for a robot that needs to continuously monitor sensor data?
Finite state machines are commonly used in robotics programming.

project.title: Simple Line-Following Robot Program
project.description: Create a program that allows a robot to follow a line using sensor inputs and motor controls.
project.instructions:
In this project, you'll write a program that enables a robot to follow a line using sensor inputs and motor controls.

Requirements:

  1. Write code to read from line sensors
  2. Implement a control algorithm for line following
  3. Use proportional control for smooth following
  4. Handle edge cases (line breaks, intersections)
  5. Test your code using the provided simulator

modules.title: Sensors and Perception
modules.description: Understanding how robots perceive their environment through sensors.

lectures.title: Introduction to Robot Sensors
lectures.description: Overview of different sensor types used in robotics.
lectures.content:
This lecture introduces the various types of sensors used in robotics, from simple light sensors to complex vision systems.

Topics covered:

  • Classification of sensors
  • Common sensor types
  • Sensor specifications and limitations
  • Choosing the right sensors for your robot

quiz.title: Robot Sensors Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge of robot sensors.

questions.question_text: Which sensor is used to measure rotational movement?
LIDAR is a technology that uses light to measure distance.

lectures.title: Processing Sensor Data
lectures.description: Techniques for processing and interpreting data from robot sensors.
lectures.content:
This lecture explores how to process and interpret the data collected by robot sensors. We'll look at filtering, calibration, and fusion techniques.

Topics covered:

  • Signal processing basics
  • Sensor calibration
  • Filtering techniques
  • Sensor fusion algorithms

quiz.title: Sensor Data Processing Quiz
quiz.description: Test your understanding of sensor data processing.

questions.question_text: Which algorithm is commonly used for sensor fusion?
Noise filtering is an important step in processing sensor data.

project.title: Sensor Integration Project
project.description: Create a program that integrates multiple sensors for improved environment perception.
project.instructions:
In this project, you'll create a program that integrates data from multiple sensors to improve a robot's perception of its environment.

Requirements:

  1. Use at least three different sensor types
  2. Implement filtering for each sensor
  3. Create a sensor fusion algorithm
  4. Visualize the combined sensor data
  5. Demonstrate improved accuracy compared to individual sensors

modules.title: Actuators and Control
modules.description: Learn how to control robot movements using different types of actuators.

lectures.title: Types of Robot Actuators
lectures.description: Overview of different actuator types and their applications.
lectures.content:
This lecture introduces the various types of actuators used in robotics, from motors to hydraulics and pneumatics.

Topics covered:

  • DC and servo motors
  • Stepper motors
  • Hydraulic actuators
  • Pneumatic systems

quiz.title: Actuators Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge of robot actuators.

questions.question_text: Which actuator type provides the most precise position control?
Stepper motors move in discrete steps rather than continuous rotation.

lectures.title: Motor Control Techniques
lectures.description: Understanding different approaches to controlling motors in robotics.
lectures.content:
This lecture explores different techniques for controlling motors in robotics applications, from basic speed control to precise position control.

Topics covered:

  • PWM speed control
  • PID position control
  • Motor drivers and H-bridges
  • Feedback mechanisms

quiz.title: Motor Control Quiz
quiz.description: Test your understanding of motor control techniques.

questions.question_text: What does PWM stand for in motor control?
PID controllers use feedback to improve control accuracy.

project.title: Precision Motor Control Project
project.description: Implement a PID controller for precise motor position control.
project.instructions:
In this project, you'll implement a PID controller to achieve precise position control of a motor.

Requirements:

  1. Set up a motor with position feedback
  2. Implement a PID controller algorithm
  3. Tune the PID parameters
  4. Test the controller with different position targets
  5. Analyze the performance and response time

capstone_project.title: Autonomous Navigation Robot
capstone_project.description: Design and program a robot capable of autonomous navigation in a simple environment.
capstone_project.instructions:
For your capstone project, you'll design and program a robot capable of autonomously navigating through an environment while avoiding obstacles.

Requirements:

  1. Select appropriate sensors for environment perception
  2. Implement sensor data processing algorithms
  3. Develop a navigation algorithm
  4. Program obstacle avoidance behaviors
  5. Test and refine your solution
  6. Demonstrate the robot navigating a course with obstacles
capstone_project.requirements: Your solution should include sensor integration, path planning, obstacle avoidance, and clear documentation of your design decisions and implementation. The robot should successfully navigate from a starting point to a goal point while avoiding obstacles.
